abstract: Let V be a countably generated Hilbert C*-module over a C*-algebra A. We prove that a sequence $\{f_{i}\colon i\in I\}\subseteq V$ is a standard frame for V if and only if the sum $\Sigma _{i\in I}\langle x,f_{i}\rangle \langle f_{i},x\rangle $ converges in norm for every x ∈ V and if there are constants C, D > 0 such that $C\|x\|^{2}\leq \|\Sigma _{i\in I}\langle x,f_{i}\rangle \langle f_{i},x\rangle \|\leq D\|x\|^{2}$ for every x ∈ V. We also prove that surjective adjointable operators preserve standard frames. A class of frames for countably generated Hilbert C*-modules over the C*-algebra of all compact operators on some Hilbert space is discussed.
